dialogue.text: ...and when the morning sun shone through their windows, it turned the cobwebs into silver and gold. And from that point on, the widow and her children would never have to live in poverty again.
This folktale, referred to mostly as “The Legend of the Christmas Spider,” dates back to the 1800’s and is thought to be conceived in either Ukraine, Germany, or Poland.

For this reason, combined with old European superstitions stating that destroying a spider’s web is bad luck, seeing spiders or spiderwebs on Christmas is now thought to bring {i}good{/i} luck instead.
Wow. And to think we got this whole lecture just because Noriko refused to step on a spider and had to {i}bring it outside{/i} instead.
Don’t mock me, Kirin! I’ve brought good luck to our dorm room for the next year!
Anyway, I guess I should start taking attendance now. Who decided to not show up today?
Ami and Sensei are-
Correction — who decided to not show up that is {i}normally here?{/i}
Rin! But I only know this because she owes me 5,000 yen from a bet and not because I still like her. Which I don’t.
Chika ain’t here either. Somethin’ about...actually, I got no fuckin’ clue. She just ain’t here.
Great. Well, I guess just fuck around until lunch or whatever. I’m not really in the mood to teach today.
Miss Imai, I have a question.
No, Touka. I’m not raising the Secret Santa spending limit again. You already talked me into 10k and even that is way too much for a bunch of mostly-unskilled teenagers.
It’s not that. I was just wondering if you are doing okay. You’ve seemed rather...off these last few days.
Yeah, well...you’d be off too if your best friend and coworker just decided to shirk all his responsibilities and vanish without so much as a goodbye.
Vanish? I was informed that the Herald of the Adolescents was merely under the weather. No one mentioned anything about vanishing.
He may as well have vanished. None of us have heard shit from him since Halloween.
Ami still...comes to school sometimes, though...and she always-
Aaaaaah! All this long division stuff is killin’ me! I ain’t got any idea what’s goin’ on with Sensei, but bring back the teacher who didn’t make me do any schoolwork!
If anyone needs me, I’ll be at my desk.
Poor Imani ain’t taking this whole Sensei situation very well, is she?
You say that like someone who hasn’t also spent the last month and a half crying over him.
You know, you’d be crying too if you hadn’t upped all your dosages just to compensate for the sudden lack of...male conversation.
Probably! Modern medicine sure is neat, isn’t it? Want to share? That worked out really well the last time I tried it.
No, Io. I don’t wanna {i}share.{/i} I wanna get our friggin’ teacher back before the whole class falls apart.
Me too. But it’s starting to look like the only way we’ll be able to do that is by tracking him down and breaking into wherever he’s staying.
I’m pretty sure he’s just at his house. That’s how Ami’s made it sound at work at least. But no matter how many times I ask her if I can come visit him, she keeps turning me away.
She did pretty much the same for me the one time I asked about him.
You actually, like...{i}talked{/i} to her? With your mouth?
No, Uta. I learned sign language for the sole purpose of communicating with her.
You joke, but I wouldn’t put that sorta thing past you.
Fair point. But yes, I {i}did{/i} talk to her. With my mouth. For maybe five whole seconds.
Desperate times call for desperate measures, and you’re obviously not the only person around here currently going through Sensei-withdrawal.
And I think I speak for everyone when I say I want him back as soon as possible.
God, what a jerk! Just imagine what sorta chaos the maid cafe would fall into if {i}I{/i} stopped coming to work every single day! Like, be considerate of others, Sensei! Come on!
Maybe we really should just break in? We can pool the money we make from our jobs to pay for whatever fine we’ll get slapped with for the attempt.
I’m pretty sure we’d just get sent to juvie. Or jail. And it’s not like you can just pay your way out of those places.
Yes you can. That’s quite literally what bond is.
No. A bond is that thing you and I have that explains why we like each other. A {i}bribe{/i} is a thing you have to pay somebody to get ‘em to do stuff.
You know, sometimes I forget that you’re kind of dumb. But then you go and say things like that and it all comes rushing back.
At least if we get arrested, I might be able to see my brother. It’s been a while.
Have him teach you more about the justice system when you do, please.
...and that’s why you should sign my petition to create more safe injection sites in the downtown area!
You {i}do{/i} realize you’re talking to the daughter of a junkie, right?

No, I didn’t actually. You never tell anybody about yourself. And if anything, wouldn’t that make you {i}more{/i} inclined to sign the petition? Because surely you must have some idea of the dangers that-
Shut up. But, {i}before{/i} you shut up, why do you keep talking to me? This is supposed to be my “stand here and mind my own business” spot and you keep fuckin’ coming over every god damn day.
Well, we’re friends now, aren’t we?
What? Fuck you talkin’ about? When the hell did that happen?
Halloween! You were the only person who knew my costume. Which means you’re into the same kind of anime that I’m into. Which means that we’re friends now.
{i}No?{/i} That ain’t how makin’ friends works, you fucking beady-eyed lunatic.
How would you know? You don’t have any. Besides me, I mean. And Chika. But Chika’s not here right now, so I’ll keep you company and make sure you don’t get lonely.
Here’s a better idea — instead of devotin’ the rest of homeroom to pissin’ me off, why don’t you take your BS petition and shove it so far up your ass that even a team of surgeons won’t be able to-
Attention, everyone!
{i}Please{/i} direct your attention over here for a {i}very{/i} special surprise!
Holy crap!
What in the ever-loving fuck?
Surprise! We switched colors.
And I look more lesbian than ever.
And {i}I{/i} am very confused. Why would you do this without asking us first?
Why should we have to consult with you and the rest of the class if we want to change our hair colors?
It’s just too much at once, okay? I’m going to keep forgetting who is who and it’s gonna fuck with my methodology when it comes to flirting with you.
Kirin, could you kindly go fuck yourself and never joke about flirting with me again? Thanks.
Can {i}you{/i} just fuck me instead?
I liked you more when we hated each other.
Kirin, the reason we switched hair colors is because {i}I{/i} was looking for a change-
And {i}I{/i} wanted to fit in a little better with the rest of the light music club!
It would have been, like...totally weird if there was some flashy gyaru following you guys around to shows.
Now, you have a cool rocker chick slash...semi-gyaru...thing. I don’t know! I’m having an identity crisis!
And it has nothing to do with me going stir crazy from not seeing my significant other in almost two months!
Hahah! Significant other!
I remember when I had one of those.
Oh, sorry. Was I supposed to react to that?
Maybe!
My bad. But I’m not really sure how I’m supposed to respond to that very obviously pointed statement.
Well...neither am I!
You’re...not sure how to respond to your {i}own{/i} statement?
I said what I said! It doesn’t need to make sense!
Right...
Well, see you at band practice I guess.
Yeah! I guess!
I see not much has changed on the breakup front, has it?
Leave it alone, Nodoka. Rin and Otoha decided on their separation mutually, so it’s best if we don’t get ourselves involved with any of the-
If you miss having someone to put your fingers inside of, I wouldn’t mind experimenting with you. As a friend, of course.
Why do I even bother talking anymore?
Are you going to tell me that every single day for the rest of my life, Nodoka? Because I’m really starting to believe you are.
There is a very simple way to shut me up, you know.
I’m good. But thanks.
I have not benefited nearly as much from this separation as I should have.
Wh...Why {i}did{/i} you and Rin...decide to break up again?...I thought you two looked...nice together...

We told you guys at the last band meeting — it was getting in the way of my music. If I want to get better, I can’t be splitting my time between a girlfriend {i}and{/i} singing. I needed to choose one.
But...doesn’t it hurt?...Knowing you used to be...you know...
Not really. I don’t think either of us expected it to last forever. We’re just teenagers, you know? Things like this happen all the time.
I...I see...
You sound rather disheartened at the passing of this tryst, Miss Sakakibara. Would you care to explain why? Or shall I assume you were just longing to be {i}involved{/i} to some extent?
Involved?...What does that mean?
Ahh...the way she feigns such innocence never fails to captivate me so. I can already feel the creative juices beginning to drip down my thighs.
I think that might be something else.
Say...do you guys think Sensei will turn up to the Christmas party this year?
Do {i}you?{/i}
I...hope so...
This has been...the longest I’ve gone without seeing him since...the two of us met...
I think there’s a chance he shows up, right? Like...he’s never missed one before. And some fresh air would probably be good for him. Assuming he isn’t already getting any.
If I didn’t know any better, I might assume you were actually {i}worried,{/i} dearest roommate.
Could it be that your maternal instinct is finally taking root? Or perhaps Onee-sama simply longs for the taste of her honorary younger brother’s-
Fuck off, Nodoka. I just want to check in on the guy, that’s all. And I know you all do as well. So why do {i}I{/i} have to be the one to say it out loud?
Perhaps you’re just the weakest?
Perhaps some of us have already said it too many times...
And p...
Perhaps...some of us...
Perhaps some of us...just...
Don’t...really care...
